com.github.mrgoro.interactivedata.api.chart.annotations

Annotation Type FunctionDef


  • public @interface FunctionDef
    Definition of a Function. Functions are used for aggregating data while grouping. Functions are always defined in combination to a Granularity inside an Operation.
    Author:
    Philipp Schürmann
    See Also:
    OperationDef, Operation, Granularity, Function

    • Required Element Summary

      Required Elements 
      Modifier and Type Required Element and Description
      java.lang.Class<?> fieldClass
      Type of the field the function operates on.
      java.lang.String fieldName
      Name of the field the function operates on.
      java.lang.Class<? extends Function<?,?>> function
      Class of the Function.

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element and Description
      Option[] options
      Options of the operation.
      java.lang.String targetFieldName
      Name of the field after the data is processed by the function.

    • Element Detail

      • fieldName

        public abstract java.lang.String fieldName
        Name of the field the function operates on.
        Returns:
        Name of the field

      • fieldClass

        public abstract java.lang.Class<?> fieldClass
        Type of the field the function operates on.

        Note that Functions do not support every type. See the documentation of the function for more information about data types supported.

        Returns:
        Type of the field

      • function

        public abstract java.lang.Class<? extends Function<?,?>> function
        Class of the Function. Function class must extend Function.
        Returns:
        Class of the Filter.

      • targetFieldName

        public abstract java.lang.String targetFieldName
        Name of the field after the data is processed by the function.

        Useful if multiple different functions operate on the same field.

        Returns:
        Name of the target field
        Default:
        ""

      • options

        public abstract Option[] options
        Options of the operation.

        Options are key value paris defined within Option annotation. These options are used to populate the options data object of the function. See the documentation of the function for more information of the available options each function has.

        Options are optional and do not have to be set.

        Returns:
        Array of options
        Default:
        {}
